issue.title: The connection between Hono MQTT adapter and gateway will broke if forward wrong topic
issue.body:
Hi,

Gateway maintain one connection between Hono MQTT adapter and will publish different message to different topic, such as below topic,
•	telemetry/tenant_id/device01
•	telemetry/tenant_id/device02
but the connection will broke if the device is not registered at Hono.

Does this make sense? If the gateway forwards an unregistered device, the connection between the gateway and hono will be disconnected, and then the gateway will try to reconnect. **During this time, the gateway will not be able to send data to Hono.**

body: @sophokles73 Could you please assign this to me, if no one is already working on it.

I agree with the handling of unprocessable Telemetry QoS 0 messages being in line with the spec and the guarantees made by Hono.

> Telemetry with QoS 1: It could leave the connection open and don't pub ack the message. Client would / could try to resend the message.

Most people I have talked to believe that this behavior is actually *not* compliant with the spec, i.e. the server only has the options to send a PUBACK or close the connection. We have decided for closing the connection as most MQTT client implementations are not prepared to *not* get a PUBACK in response to a PUBLISH. However, they can always handle the server close the connection.

For events, the situation is even worse FMPOV as a client usually publishes an event for something serious and for which it wants to be sure that the event has been received (and persisted) by Hono. Otherwise, the same arguments against simply not sending a PUBACK apply here as well.

What I can image, though, is providing a separate topic for signalling errors to the device. The device could, for example, subscribe to `tenant/device/errors` and receive error messages indicating the reason for not being able to process a message. The MQTT adapter could then
1. send a PUBACK in response to an unprocessable message,
2. drop the unprocessable message and
3. PUBLISH a corresponding error message to the device.

We could then configure at the tenant level, if the MQTT adapter should close the connection on errors or act as described above.

@calohmn @ctron @dejanb WDYT?
Sounds good. As the error topic, I would suggest using `errors/${tenant-id}/${device-id}` (keeping it in line with the `[event|telemetry|command]/${tenant-id}/${device-id}` topic structure).
@calohmn  Could you please provide some ideas how these error messages will look like? To make sure that the clients can react on them appropriately.

> if the MQTT adapter should close the connection on errors

If the device connection is closed because of Hono internal error and this error is still there. What about the next device attempt to connect? I am asking this question because the device reconnection exponential backoff algorithm usually relies on the connection failure. If the next connection is successful and almost immediately disconnected, it'll end with an infinite loop. Actually, I am curios, did you check it with Eclipse Paho?

> act as described above.

@sophokles73, what is the scope of these errors? Do they represent the Hono state or something like a message status?
